metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5185 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Blink in Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.59 for Windows, Mac, and Linux;54.0.2840.85 for Android incorrectly allowed reentrance ofFrameView::updateLifecyclePhasesInternal(), which allowed a remote attackerto perform an out of bounds memory read via crafted HTML pages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
oxide-qt package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
